attributes.action: intervene in the case of Alhassan "Al" Bangura
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
Watford Football Club's 19-year-old player Alhassan Bangura faces deportation to Sierra Leone after losing his case to stay in the UK at an Asylum and Immigration Tribunal hearing. 
Alhassan Bangura, who became a father  nine days ago, arrived from Sierra Leone four years ago, escaping the civil war there, and was given limited discretionary leave to stay. 

The Home Office is initiating moves to remove him from this country.

We ask that the Prime Minister consider the case of a young footballer and father who has rebuilt his life to remain in this country.

rejection.details: Individual cases are a matter for direct correspondence with the Home Office.
reasons: Issues for which an e-petition is not the appropriate channel
